info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 17 at 1:47PM MDT until April 17 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... Northwestern Otero County in south central New Mexico... Southeastern Sierra County in south central New Mexico... Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico...
* Until 415 PM MDT.
* At 145 PM MDT, plumes of blowing dust were expanding across south central New Mexico. One plume of dense dust was moving into the Las Cruces area, and will drop visibility significantly in the next 15 to 30 minutes. Another plume was stretching into the Hatch Valley from the Deming area.
HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong winds up to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Satellite imagery.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 110 and 147. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 52. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 178.
Locations impacted include... Las Cruces, Hatch, White Sands Missile Range Headquarters, NMSU Main Campus, Fort Selden State Historic Site, Rincon, Hill, Northeast Las Cruces, Garfield, Radium Springs, Soledad Canyon, San Pablo, Mesilla, Dona Ana, Aguirre Springs, Picacho, Mesilla Valley Bosque State Park, Derry, Lake Lucero, and Talavera.
info.instruction:
Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 4:15 PM MDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 4:15 PM MDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; Otero, NM; Sierra, NM

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 4:15 PM MDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 4:15 PM MDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; Otero, NM; Sierra, NM
